newsitem.title: GERMANY: Buba says will set next two repos at fixed 3 pct.
newsitem.headline: Buba says will set next two repos at fixed 3 pct.

text.p: The Bundesbank said on Thursday it planned to keep its main money market rate unchanged for another two weeks by setting its next two securities repurchase tenders at a fixed three percent rate.
The Bundesbank was holding its regular council meeting.
The council left all three main rates, the discount, the Lombard and the repo unchanged and money market traders said this had been expected as there were no economic pressures demanding a change.
The discount and Lombard rates were left at 2.50 percent and 4.50 percent respectively.
